name: frlmrcl
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4

stmt.origin: strov2rcl(c0, c1, c2, c3, cfrlm, c4)
stmt.pretty: strov2rcl(c0, c1, c2, c3, cfrlm, c4)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, universe))
-| wceq(c3, co(c2, cfrlm, c4))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c3))
-| wrel(cdm(cfrlm))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 → c2 ∈ 𝕌)
⊣ c3 =(c2[freeLMod]c4)
⊣ c1 =(Base ` c3)
⊣ Rel(dom(freeLMod))

stmt.origin: reldmmpt2(hs0, hs1, cfrlm, universe, universe, co(cv(hs0), cdsmm, cxp(cv(hs1), csn(cfv(crglmod, cv(hs0))))))
stmt.pretty: reldmmpt2(hs0, hs1, cfrlm, universe, universe, (hs0[(+)m](hs1 × {(ringLMod ` hs0)})))

body.origin:
|- wrel(cdm(cfrlm))
-| wceq(cfrlm, cmpo(hs0, hs1, universe, universe, co(cv(hs0), cdsmm, cxp(cv(hs1), csn(cfv(crglmod, cv(hs0)))))))
-| diffss(hs0, hs1)
-| diffsc(hs1, universe)
body.pretty:
⊢ Rel(dom(freeLMod))
⊣ freeLMod =(hs0 ∈ 𝕌, hs1 ∈ 𝕌 ↦(hs0[(+)m](hs1 × {(ringLMod ` hs0)})))
⊣ d(hs0, hs1)
⊣ d(hs1, 𝕌)

comment: If a free module is inhabited, this is sufficient to conclude that the ring expression defines a set. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 3-Feb-2015.)
